title: Acela
summary: The Acela (/əˈsɛlə/ ə-SEL-ə; originally the Acela Express until September 2019) is Amtrak's flagship high-speed service along the Northeast Corridor (NEC) in the Northeastern United States between Washington, D.C. and Boston via 16 intermediate stops, including Baltimore, Philadelphia, New York City, and Providence. Acela trains are the fastest in the Americas, attaining 150 mph (240 km/h) (qualifying as high-speed rail), but only on 33.9 miles (54.6 km) of the 457-mile (735 km) route.[7]
